TABLE.ENTRY: CHEBI:28087 glycogen A polydisperse, highly branched glucan composed of chains of D-glucopyranose residues in α(1→4) glycosidic linkage, joined together by α(1→6) glycosidic linkages. A small number of α(1→3) glycosidic linkages and some cumulative α(1→6) links also may occur. The branches in glycogen typically contain 8 to 12 glucose residues. 3 CHEBI:5466 CHEBI:24379 liver starch Glycogen animal starch 9005-79-2 9005-79-2 C00182 </ENTR
